list.workshopTitle: From seed funding to the next funding round
list.workshopDesc: The road from seed to A round is a tricky one, lots of variables to manage and a strong focus on execution. Join the workshop to discuss how VC can help you to reach the next funding round and what it means to work with a hands-on investor.

list.workshopTitle: The value of design thinking in business development
list.workshopDesc:
How often you ask yourself following questions: will people use my product or service? How can I be sure that we are creating value before we commit large resources to the project? Design thinking can help to answer to these questions.
Design thinking is a creative approach to define end users needs and to propose a unique solution for them. The approach uses algorithms and tools of designers and engineers in relation to a wide range of tasks.
The workshop is interactive: theoretical blocks alternate with practical assignments. As a result, of the workshop, participants will be able to get basic understanding of design thinking and use studied techniques into their working routine.

Do you want to learn to do efficient video advertising plan through script and editing to the final product? This is the right workshop for you. We'll get hands dirty by analysing projects and practice. If you have a project going on, bring it to the workshop and get professional help! If you don't, no worries, you're very welcome and you'll learn by analysing ohthers.

list.workshopTitle: How to find your tech co-founder
list.workshopDesc:
Do you have a great business idea, but no-one who can build it? Have you been struggling to find a co-founder, or early employee who has the capability to create your product? Do you feel like nothing more can be done? If yes, then join this workshop and we'll teach you a more systematic approach to find just the person you're looking for.
In this workshop we'll be starting from a general level of what to look for in co-founders, and then diving a bit deeper into the technical ones. We'll also discuss search and outreach strategies to help you in actually finding the right people. During the workshop we'll introduce and start working on a few templates and frameworks to help you kickoff your search. Please bring a laptop, or notebook + pen!
Book your 1 on 1 meeting for mingle, interview, catch up, brainstorm or anything!

list.workshopTitle: Build a Photo-Sharing Web App with AWS
list.workshopDesc:
In the workshop we‚Äôll build a photo sharing web app with smart tagging & search functionality.
This is a hands-on, bring-your-own-laptop workshop aimed at (front-end) developers. Minimal knowledge of JavaScript is required.
After completion the participants will be able to adapt and re-use the material from this workshop to quickly build their own projects.

Vertical OPEN‚Ñ¢ is a board game business simulator that teaches you to think critically and creatively about collaborative innovation tools. How should one manage a business through ever-disruptive technologies and turbulent industry times? Designed by the collaborative design team at Vertical, OPEN invites you to navigate open innovation opportunities and learn how to achieve better performance through co-creation.

This class is for individuals and teams interested in human behavioural change as an outcome of their projects.</br></br>Behaviour Design is a new discipline concerned with practical approaches to behavioural change. It combines behavioural science with design thinking methods. The focus in this class is digital technology as an extension of behaviour.</br></br>You will use the Behaviour Design Canvas, a method developed by Ashwin Rajan, teacher of the class. This can now be downloaded for free here (link: [Behaviour Design Canvas](https://www.behaviourdesigncanvas.info/).</br></br>We will cover:</br>* What is behaviour design and how it works in a digital world.</br>* Behaviour design ethics and Dark Patterns.</br>* Overview of core behaviour change elements, such as motivation.</br>* The Behaviour Design Canvas method and how to use it.</br>The class will be packed with theory, discussions and exercises. If you are working on a project or service that has a behavioural side to it, all the better.</br>Come well rested and prepared for a mental workout!

list.workshopTitle: Scaling design efforts in growth companies

list.workshopDesc:
The Speaker will be sharing her thoughts on marketing with identifying your focus areas and how to iterate your growth with data.
Workshop items:
1. Identifying your growth phase and where you should focus on right now
2. Bottle neck funnel model to identify and fix growth problems
3. Basics of metrics and collecting the data
Also, here‚Äôs a couple great reads & views on topics related to topics we‚Äôll be discussing:
Identifying our phase and focusing on right things:
https://firstround.com/review/from-zero-to-ipo-how-growth-needs-to-evolve-at-every-startup-stage/
Finding your product/market fit:
https://firstround.com/review/how-superhuman-built-an-engine-to-find-product-market-fit/
Necessary metrics you should be familiar with:
https://medium.com/icebreakervc/guide-to-necessary-startup-marketing-metrics-cac-roi-ltv-dfbd03df440
Book your 1 on 1 meeting  for mingle, interview, catch up, brainstorm or anything!

Designed by the collaborative design team at Vertical, OPEN invites you to navigate open innovation opportunities and learn how to achieve better performance through co-creation.

Ever wondered if you could have explained something better, to convince someone or make a sale? Maybe a good visualisation would have helped! Join this workshop to discuss the power of visualisation and how to do it right. You‚Äôll get to work on your own complex concept or data, which you know to be the answer to that problem you want to see solved, but others don‚Äôt seem to get it (yet)! The workshop inspires design thinking and helps you become a more effective communicator. Our tools are paper and pen, a drawing tool or PowerPoint ‚Äì whatever works best for you.

list.workshopTitle: How to distribute shares in the company
list.workshopDesc: Hey you, upcoming founder or curious mind! Having issues deciding how to split up the equity in your business between your team (co-founder), advisors, and potential investors? In this workshop you'll learn about the tips and tricks you should know before founding a company, and how to distribute the shares wisely. We will also demystify venture capital by teaching the fundamentals of it.
Book your 1 on 1 meeting  for mingle, interview, catch up, brainstorm or anything!

list.workshopTitle: Threat modelling your product or service
list.workshopDesc: How to find security and privacy risks in your product's user experience and technical design? Laura Noukka (https://twitter.com/LauraNoukka) and Antti V√§h√§-Sipil√§ (https://twitter.com/anttivs) will teach two methodologies that designers and developers can use to uncover these risks. One of the methods is better suited for analysis of customer journeys and UX flows, and the other for technical architecture and system design. Both are geared towards producing actionable backlog items. We will also discuss how threat modelling can be integrated in your development flow to produce ongoing evidence, should you ever need to seek some sort of certification for your product.We're looking for examples we could use as practice targets. If you have either of the following and are open for discussing them openly, please contact us:‚Ä¢ A customer journey map or an epic (a bundle of user stories) with external customers ‚Ä¢ A technical design, preferably application & orchestration level one with external connections and multiple back-end services.

Do you think that it is time to step-up from running post-it workshops? Are you tired of compiling PowerPoints with generic customer personas? It is time to base your design in business- and fact-driven practices. Sasha Kazantsev will share a set of practical tools that help unlock collaboration processes in the field of innovation. You will leave the workshop with tools for finding the problem-solution fit and defining business cases.

How to create and design a product your clients and your clients' clients will love? In this workshop we'll dive deeper in the whats, whys and hows on designing a customer centric product and what's the business value of always keeping your users in mind.

list.workshopTitle: Why Your Marketing Needs to be Data-Driven
list.workshopDesc: What are the numbers that you should be following and how should you use them to reach your target audience at the right place at the right time? Data-driven marketing helps you improve your audience targeting, personalize communication, and increase customer engagement. Data-driven marketing should be important for every company and in this workshop, you will understand what it is all about.
Book your 1 on 1 meeting  for mingle, interview, catch up, brainstorm or anything!

list.workshopTitle: Threat modelling your product or service
list.workshopDesc: How to find security and privacy risks in your product's user experience and technical design? Laura Noukka (https://twitter.com/LauraNoukka) and Antti V√§h√§-Sipil√§ (https://twitter.com/anttivs) will teach two methodologies that designers and developers can use to uncover these risks. One of the methods is better suited for analysis of customer journeys and UX flows, and the other for technical architecture and system design. Both are geared towards producing actionable backlog items. We will also discuss how threat modelling can be integrated in your development flow to produce ongoing evidence, should you ever need to seek some sort of certification for your product.We're looking for examples we could use as practice targets. You want to grow your startup? Struggling with finding the best talent? Do you understand the benefits of becoming a talent-driven organization, but don't know where to start exactly? This 2-hour employer branding workshop will help you figure out what to prioritize, where to start, what to continue and what not to focus on at all. We'll be very hands-on with this, but you'll of course get an inspirational boost, also! In this workshop, you'll learn the ins and outs of employer branding, like recruitment marketing in social media, EB ‚ù§Ô∏è data, employee experience, and collaboration activities. You will leave this session feeling energized and filled with ideas on what to do next when thinking about growing your company's headcount.

<q>I say we are Agile and therefore we are?</q>.</br> Do you know why</br>- retrospectives are essential and you should have them regularly,</br>- roadmap and backlog are related and essential to your success,</br>- use sprint based development and when not,</br>- Kanban can kill your efficiency when done wrong,</br>- there should be daily meetings face-to-face, and</br>- fake agile?</br>We will go first 'learn by doing' for the first hour and the dissect and advance our learning a bit further on the second hour.

list.workshopTitle: Customer centric branding, marketing and design
list.workshopDesc:
In my workshop, I‚Äôll give you the tools how to develop a genuinely customer centric product that resonates with your target audience.
You will learn how to
üëâ find out what people actually want and need.
üëâ create an appealing brand that stands apart from your competitors.

list.workshopTitle: Content creation: Story telling for SoMe
list.workshopDesc: Want to turn dry professional messages into emotionally engaging, credibility-enhancing experiences? How to make them inspiring, meaningful, and interactive? Having trouble coming up with the right mix of posts? Don‚Äôt know what to say, or don‚Äôt have the time to post it? In this workshop you will learn about visual storytelling and when, what, and where to apply them. It will cover everything you need to know about creating killer content for the top social media platforms like Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and LindkeIn. There will be hands-on practice about various content types, sharing platforms, and what might work best for your business. Learn how to plan and create a month‚Äôs worth of content in a few hours. Get familiar with using tools that will make creating and scheduling your content easier.
Book your 1 on 1 meeting  for mingle, interview, catch up, brainstorm or anything!

list.workshopTitle: Setting up CI/CD pipeline and integration tests for a web application
list.workshopDesc:
When developing an application, it is import to setup a continuous integration pipeline as early as possible. Continuous integration encourages frequent automated testing, gives immediate feedback on the effect of local changes on system-wide behaviour, and all in all helps detect bugs early.
In this workshop, we'll setup a continuous integration pipeline for a web application using CircleCI. We'll also write integration tests for a web application using Unmock and measure test coverage.
Prerequisites: Basic knowledge of JavaScript, Node.js and git

list.workshopTitle: Landing pages and SEO: How to be found and attack organic growth
list.workshopDesc: Landing pages serve multiple purposes but are typically only thought as SEO boosters. I want to break this common misconception and bring up other types of landing pages as well. In this workshop we‚Äôll go through best practises and your MVP‚Äôs.

If you are excited about service or product you want to develop, learn how to understand the user's journey and value the service gives to the user.  What kind of impacts do these tools have on the environment and the user within an holistic design process? You will as well get an introduction to  some cloud powered AI tools and choose how these could add value to your service.  The outcomes will be some more knowledge of  applying AI tools to different services and an understanding of the design process.

Welcome to learn how to NLP with R (partly) hands on! We'll go through
- Basic text wrangling
- Visualisation eg. wordclouds
- Predictive model(s) (focus on Starspace)
- How to actually use the model
- Some examples
You'll need your laptop, R and preferably RStudio installed if you want to follow hands on. Bring also your curious self!

So you‚Äôve founded your company and are really excited about the journey ahead ‚Äì great! Do you know how to make that great new venture of yours compliant with laws so that you can keep that laser focus on building traction and ABCing? Maybe you‚Äôve heard all those veteran founders talk about liqprefs, vesting, non-compete carveouts and other important-sounding legal stuff but don‚Äôt really know how to navigate your way around them. We‚Äôre here to help! Come join our workshop focusing on post-founding legal and governance topics. If you already know the lingo, here are some buzzwords that we aim to cover: early-stage corporate governance, SHA considerations, equity incentive programs, employment contracts, financing round preparations and completion.
Book your 1 on 1 meeting  for mingle, interview, catch up, brainstorm or anything!
A deep dive into the markets of blockchain and decentralized finance. We‚Äôll also cover topics within bitcoin, altcoins, and fintech.

If you don‚Äôt think measuring your business performance is a number one priority listen up! Setting the right goals and measuring them reliably is a key stepping stone for growing your business. And if you don‚Äôt get it right, it can lead you down the wrong path. We‚Äôll discuss how to set the right KPI‚Äôs and measure them, and look at some real world examples. We‚Äôll also get our hands dirty with concrete case work.

If you are an intermediate level videographers who are familiar with interface of Adobe Premiere Pro CC and have done some simple editing with it before, and would like to become better at color correction and know other tips. Come join the workshop!
Our goal to achieves are:
Understanding color and basic color correction
Usage of curve function
Understanding LUT and creating own look
Using mask to isolate specific area of frame

list.workshopTitle: How to land your ideal job as a developer?
list.workshopDesc: Developers are in demand and finding a job should be easy, right? Turns out that not all jobs are alike and even the ones that seem promising may not be what they appear on the surface. In addition to that, the way most companies do tech recruitment is broken, with unpredictable processes, pointless whiteboard challenges and time consuming home assignments. This session will help you cut through the noise. You'll learn how to identify the good companies early on, make the interview process less stressful and put you in a position where you have multiple offers to choose from within record time.

As a growth hacker, I've seen a lot of startups and scaleups that have a clear goal to grow their businesses. However, there is no easy way to the top. In a workshop, I‚Äôll summarise the most common weaknesses that keep startups and scaleups from growing. Moreover, I‚Äôll share my best tips how to fix or prevent these problems.
Book your 1 on 1 meeting  for mingle, interview, catch up, brainstorm or anything!

list.workshopTitle: Computer Vision: how to teach a Machine identify things from an Image
list.workshopDesc:
Computer Vision workshop with Microsoft
Are you getting started with exploring computer vision? Interested in how can you easily build your custom image classification? Or how to deploy your models to IoT Edge devices, allowing you to process images and make decisions on the device (without going to the cloud)?
Join us for an introductory workshop with Microsoft where we‚Äôll explore
‚Ä¢ Using pre-made Computer Vision services, like Vision API or Face API on Microsoft Azure
‚Ä¢ Building custom image classifiers with http://customvision.ai
‚Ä¢ Containerizing and deploying your custom models to IoT Edge devices
We will provide attendees with the access to Microsoft Azure. Please bring your own laptop to the event (PC, Mac, Linux).

The workshop will be an inspirational, motivational, and cooperative sales training program that simplifies sales basics and provides a tangible and easy to use blueprint for novices and seasoned salespeople to apply to real life selling situations.
Each participant will:
- Understand what value-based solution selling is
- Write a compelling value proposition and sales script
- Gain insight into customers‚Äô situation
- Address objections to proposed solutions and create negotiations leverage
- Close for the sale or next steps

list.workshopTitle: Stop for motion - add life to your content
list.workshopDesc: If you're a somewhat experienced content producer or a video editor looking for simple ways of adding animation to your toolbox come join us when we go through:</br>Simple animations in UI - How to add excitement to your UI elements</br>Creating titles/lower thirds for videos - You have that awesome video ready but you want that text/title to pop out</br>Creating a fake 3D photo - Breathe life to those still images</br></br>This workshop is for you if you're:</br>- Producing ad/social media content for your company but struggle with animations/motion design</br>- Doing UI design and wish to grasp the base concepts of motion design</br>- Video editor looking to expand your toolbox with simple animation</br>- All of the aboveü§î (as I am)</br></br>We will cover basic concepts of using motion design in your content while doing experiments. Content will be provided by speaker but you are free to use your own content if you wish.</br>Programs that we will use:</br>Illustrator (+Photoshop)</br>After Effects

Great people build great products, but how to attract the best and how to build a winning team? How to make sure you have the right team and talent onboard from the start and how to keep them in the ever tightening talent war? How to make sure you invest enough in your most valuable asset - a winning team? You will leave this session with tools to identify your organization's unique selling point, to attract the right people and to make sure you build a culture that is also able to keep the best talent!
Book your 1 on 1 meeting  for mingle, interview, catch up, brainstorm or anything!
